rev.comment: /* Necrophilia as represented in the arts */
rev.diff:
Line 147: Line 147:
A Japanese sub genre of both horror and pornography called [[ero guro]] or "erotic grotesque" often deals with necrophilia.
A Japanese sub genre of both horror and pornography called [[ero guro]] or "erotic grotesque" often deals with necrophilia.
â
Legendary [[thrash metal]] band [[Slayer]] recorded a song entitled 'Necrophiliac' for their 1985 album [[Hell Awaits]]. It is one of Slayer's most controversial songs and the first song detailing the acts of necrophilia known.
+
The [[thrash metal]] band [[Slayer]] recorded a song entitled 'Necrophiliac' for their 1985 album [[Hell Awaits]]. It is one of Slayer's most controversial songs and the first song detailing the acts of necrophilia known.
The full version of [[Type O Negative]]'s song [[Black No. 1]] holds a line that makes reference to Necrophilia. The line in the song reads "Loving you was like loving the dead...was like fucking the dead."
The full version of [[Type O Negative]]'s song [[Black No. 1]] holds a line that makes reference to Necrophilia. The line in the song reads "Loving you was like loving the dead...was like fucking the dead."
Line 156: Line 156:
The opening line of the [[Cradle of Filth]] song "Lord Abortion" from their album [[Midian (album)|Midian]], ("care for a little necrophilia, hm?") is a quote from Terry Gilliam's Brazil (voiced by Kim Greist in the film but delivered on the song by Toni King, the wife of the band's vocalist/co-creator Dani Filth).
The opening line of the [[Cradle of Filth]] song "Lord Abortion" from their album [[Midian (album)|Midian]], ("care for a little necrophilia, hm?") is a quote from Terry Gilliam's Brazil (voiced by Kim Greist in the film but delivered on the song by Toni King, the wife of the band's vocalist/co-creator Dani Filth).
  +   +
The viedo for [[Tom Petty]]'s song [[Mary Jane's Last Dance]] depicts him stealing a corpse of a woman (played by [[Kim Basinger]]) from a morgue for a dinner date and clothing her in a wedding dress; at the end he throws her off a cliff into the sea.
